terms:
Welcome to the MyBayshoreCare™ website and mobile application (together, the “Site”).  Bayshore HealthCare Ltd. and its affiliates (together, “Bayshore”) provide certain healthcare and home care support services (“Services”) to individuals across Canada (each a “Client” and together, “Clients”).  
This Site is made available for use by Clients, parties who are authorized by a Client to access that Client’s records within the Site (each a “Caregiver” and together, “Caregivers”) (both Clients and Caregivers are referred to herein as “you”) and Bayshore personnel providing Services to Clients (“Bayshore Care Team”).  
If you are at least the age of majority in the jurisdiction in which you will access the Site and a Client has authorized you to access their information on the Site and you wish to do so, please read these terms and conditions of use and Bayshore’s Privacy Policy, found at https://www.bayshore.ca/privacy-policy/, incorporated herein by reference, (collectively, the “Terms”) in their entirety.  If you do not agree to the Terms, you may not access or use the Site.  If you have read, understood and agree to the Terms, please indicate your agreement by clicking your acceptance below.  

Upon acceptance of the Terms and the creation of a user account, you will be provided access to and use of the Site and the information and functionality therein (together, the “Content”).  You will be required to create a username and password and to provide personal information which may include your name, email address, postal code, and phone number to create an account on the Site.  The personal information that you provide shall be used solely for the purposes of: (i) confirming that you have been authorized by the Client to access the Client’s information on the Site, and (ii) the creation of your user account for the Site.  You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your username and password, and for all activities that occur under these credentials.  Bayshore reserves the right to suspend or terminate your user account and your access to the Site where Bayshore has reasonable grounds to suspect that you are sharing these credentials.  You agree to notify Bayshore immediately of any unauthorized use of your credentials or any other breach of security, and to ensure that you exit from your user account each time you access the Site.  Bayshore will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from its failure or your failure to protect your username, password, or any other Site account information. Please refer to Bayshore’s Privacy Policy https://www.bayshore.ca/privacy-policy/ and direct any related privacy concerns to privacyofficer@bayshore.ca.  

The Site is designed to: (i) inform you of a Client’s current care plan, Services provided to a Client during individual visits, non-urgent information relating to Clients’ general wellbeing and home care requirements, and other Bayshore services that may be of interest to you; and (ii) facilitate offline (i.e., not real-time) messaging communication between the Bayshore Care Team and you in relation to non-urgent Client matters.  
The Site is NOT designed to: (i) communicate urgent or emergency information in relation to Clients; (ii) be a substitution for in-person or real-time communication between you and the Bayshore Care Team; (iii) provide medical advice or information about any diagnosis and treatment; or (iv) be used for any purpose except as described herein.
Bayshore reserves the right in its sole discretion to: (i) change these Terms at any time without prior notice. Any such changes are effective immediately upon posting and your continued access to and use of the Site shall be deemed to be acceptance of the then current Terms; (ii) alter the Content of the Site; and (iii) terminate or suspend your access to the Site for any reason, including, without limitation, in the event of misuse or otherwise. 
The Site is hosted and managed on Bayshore’s behalf by a third party service provider. The Site may also contain links to third party websites or references to products, services or publications other than those of Bayshore. These links and references are provided for your convenience only and do not imply the endorsement or approval of such websites, products, services or publications by Bayshore.  The Site provides the option to use Facebook Messenger and/or other instant messaging providers (together, “IM Provider”) to communicate with the Bayshore Care Team. This functionality requires you to independently establish an IM Provider account. If you choose to enable IM Provider functionality within the Site, you acknowledge and agree that the privacy policy of such IM Provider shall apply to your use of such instant messaging functionality and that Bayshore shall not be liable in any manner whatsoever for any privacy issue arising out of or in connection with such usage.  Please refer to the privacy policy of the applicable IM Provider.

The Site uses cookies to collect information about usage patterns. This information is used by Bayshore to assist with tracking traffic and Site usage, and to develop Content that addresses your interests. Cookies do not contain any personal information and cannot be used to identify you personally. You may view and revise your cookie preferences through your web browser.

YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT YOUR USE OF THE SITE, THE CONTENT, AND ANY SERVICES OR ITEMS FOUND OR ATTAINED THROUGH THE SITE IS AT YOUR OWN RISK. THE SITE IS PROVIDED “AS IS” OR “AS AVAILABLE,” WITH ALL FAULTS. BAYSHORE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.  NEITHER BAYSHORE NOR ITS DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, THIRD PARTY SERVICE PROVIDERS, OR SUCCESSORS MAKE ANY WARRANTY, REPRESENTATION, OR ENDORSEMENT WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPLETENESS, SECURITY, RELIABILITY, SUITABILITY, ACCURACY, CURRENCY, OR AVAILABILITY OF THE SITE OR THE CONTENT.

NEITHER BAYSHORE NOR ITS DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, THIRD PARTY SERVICE PROVIDERS, OR SUCCESSORS SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, ARISING OUT OF YOUR ACCESS TO, USE OF, OR INABILITY TO USE, OR RELIANCE ON THE SITE; ANY INACCURACIES OR OMISSIONS OF THE CONTENT OR IN RELATION TO ANY VIRUSES THAT MAY IMPACT YOUR COMPUTER SYSTEMS OR OTHERWISE; ANY OTHER CHANGES, SUSPENSIONS OR DISCONTINUANCES OF THE SITE AND THE CONTENT; OR THE CONTENT, INABILITY TO USE, THE PRIVACY PRACTICES UTILIZED OR OTHERWISE IN RELATION TO ANY THIRD PARTY WEBSITES THAT MAY BE ACCESSIBLE VIA LINKS ON THE SITE.
You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Bayshore and its officers, directors, employees, agents, third party service providers and successors from and against all claims, liabilities, losses, expenses, damages and costs, including reasonable attorneys' fees (collectively, “Losses”) resulting from: (i) your use of or reliance on the Site and the Content; (ii) your breach or alleged breach of these Terms; (iii) your failure to comply with any applicable laws; (iv) your negligence, willful misconduct, or violations of the intellectual property or other rights of any person, including, without limitation, obscene or indecent postings; (v) any of your dealings or transactions with other persons resulting from use of the Site including, without limitation, the use of links to third party websites contained on the Site and third party service providers including, without limitation, AlayaCare, Stripe or any replacement e-commerce providers, and IM Providers. You will be required to completely and fully indemnify Bayshore for any Losses.
The laws of the Province of Ontario and federal laws of Canada applicable therein shall govern the Terms, the Site and your use of the Site, without regard to conflicts of laws principles and the location from which you are accessing the Site. You agree to irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located within the Province of Ontario in relation to claims arising under or related to the Site or the Terms. You waive any and all objections to the exercise of jurisdiction over you by such courts and to the venue of such courts. Bayshore’s failure to exercise or enforce any right or provision of the Terms shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision. If any provision of the Terms is held to be unlawful, void or unenforceable, then such provision shall be severable without affecting the enforceability of all remaining provisions. The Terms and Bayshore’s Privacy Policy constitute the sole and entire agreement between you and Bayshore regarding the Site and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous understandings, agreements, representations and warranties, both written and oral, regarding such subject matter.  
Should you have any questions or concerns about these Terms, please contact the Site Administrator at clientservice@bayshore.ca.  If you wish to discontinue access to the Site at any time, please notify the Site Administrator at clientservice@bayshore.ca. 
 
MyBayshoreCare™, Bayshore HealthCare®, Bayshore®, Bayshore Home Health®, Bayshore Home Care Solutions™, Bayshore HealthCare Solutions™, Bayshore Specialty Rx®, Bayshore Therapy and Rehab®, Carepath® and Integrated Care Solutions™ are owned by or licensed to Bayshore.  All elements of the Site including, without limitation, the general design and the Content, are the property of Bayshore, its licensors, or other providers of such material and are subject to intellectual property laws, including, without limitation, copyright protection. No license or right, express or implied, is granted to any person under any intellectual property rights.

text_explore_detail_text:
Introducing Explore, a feature that allow’s you to view, post, and comment on your favourite health topics. Whether you’re interested diabetes care or want to share your experience with other’s, there will be a conversation waiting for you. 

Contact your Bayshore branch to check availably in your region for this feature.
text_explore_content: Start conversations and connect with your community
text_bayshore_content:
Bayshore Voice leverages your home smart system to offer a way to remotely check in on your loved ones and send them reminders. You can easily set up check-in questions or reminders from the MyBayshoreCare App.

 Contact your Bayshore branch to check availably in your region for this feature.

virtual_visits_overview_content: Bayshore now offers virtual care options for you or your loved one to connect with our dedicated care specialists for you non-urgent care needs. You can connect with a care team specialist over phone or video from the comfort of your home using our online platform MyBayshoreCare.
virtual_visit_what_is_desc: Virtual care is a service that allows our care specialists, nurses and caregivers the ability to visit you in your home, using a phone call or a video call. Many services like health consultations, assessments, safety checks and medication reminders can be provided over the phone or over a video call, and this is called an eVisit. Bayshore Virtual Care is a service that allows you to:
virtual_visit_bullet_item3: Spend less time travelling to appointments
virtual_visit_bullet_item4: Have your condition monitored from home
text_virtual_care_call_description: Join the virtual event by clicking on the “Join Call” button. The button will be activated 5 minutes before the scheduled time.

pleaseTellUs: Please tell us a bit about yourself!
terms_agreement_optional_content:
The Bayshore Digital Community is comprised of Clients and Caregivers that provide Bayshore with information/ feedback on their healthcare service experiences with Bayshore (“Feedback”). Bayshore views Client and Caregiver input as essential to Bayshore’s successful provision of Services. Please note that participation in the Bayshore Digital Community is NOT required in order to access and use the Site.
You understand and agree that you are fully responsible for any Feedback you submit or contribute, and you are fully responsible and legally liable, including to any third party, for such content and its accuracy. If you choose to provide Feedback, Bayshore does not claim ownership of the Feedback you provide; however, by providing Feedback, you are granting Bayshore and any necessary sub-licensees the right to a perpetual, irrevocable, non-exclusive licence to use the Feedback in connection with improving its healthcare service offering and in the operation of its business, including, without limitation, the rights to: copy, distribute, transmit, publicly display, publicly perform, reproduce, edit, translate and reformat your Feedback; and to publish your name and any contact information you approve of in connection with your Feedback. You further waive any moral rights or other rights of authorship as a condition of submitting any Feedback. No compensation will be paid with respect to the use by Bayshore of your Feedback. Bayshore is under no obligation to use any Feedback you may provide and Bayshore may cease the use of any Feedback at any time in its sole discretion. Any improvements, enhancements or modifications to Bayshore products or services made through the use or incorporation of your Feedback will be the property of Bayshore without any consideration to you.

text_service_detail_text: Bayshore Home Health is all about trust. We provide personalized home care services to meet your needs. We make home care simple – your dedicated Care Manager works with you to design a customized care plan to provide the support you need at home.
text_service_detail_text_health_monitor:
Our health monitor provides a comprehensive view of your loved one’s activities, keeping you informed and with the knowledge they are safe. Simply connect your loved wearable device to our app for continuous monitoring of their safety. You can also set up alerts to be notified if your loved one is in an unfamiliar place.

Contact your Bayshore branch to check availably in your region for this feature.
text_service_detail_text_contacts:
Do your aging parents or elderly loved ones depend on you for care? Let Bayshore be part of this caregiving journey with you. We make the process of arranging home care simple by taking care of all the details.

We offer a wide range of personalized home and community health care services through more than 70 locations across Canada.

please_complete_assement: Please complete your assessment in MBC app
assessment_limit: The assessments are limited one per day.
what_is_mgdl_content: The Myasthenia Gravis Activities of Daily Living (MG-ADL) scale assesses the impact of gMG on daily functions by measuring 8 signs or symptoms that are commonly affected by gMG.
what_is_mgdl_full_content:
The Myasthenia Gravis Activities of Daily Living (MG-ADL) scale assesses the impact of gMG on daily functions by measuring 8 signs or symptoms that are commonly affected by gMG. Each item is measured on a 4-point scale, where a score of 0 represents normal function and a score of 3 represents the loss of ability to perform that function. Total scores range from 0 to 24 points, with a higher score showing more severe gMG. 

 Use the MG-ADL scales on this app to track your symptoms regularly. If you track them weekly, try to do it at the same time every week for consistency. Your Nurse Case Manager will receive this information and may share this with your Neurologist as it may help them detemine your next treatment cycle. This assessment lets you be your own advocate. Knowing what your symptoms are every week may help your doctor help you.
impairment_ability: Please score your impairment of ability to brush teeth or comb hair
impairment_of_ability_to_arise: Please score your impairment of ability to arise from the chair

still_there_content:
Seems like you've been idle for over 10 minutes. Your MG-ADL assessment time will end in 30 seconds, click confirm to proceed or cancel to exit the assessment.

Your progress will not be saved if you choose to quit now.
